bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Finley was a U.S. Army officer, Lieutenant, 10th cavalry, in Texas, 1880-1881, Fort Leavenworth, Kansas, 1881-1884, and Arizona, 1885-1892.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Diary, notebooks, biographical material, and photographs relating to Finley's Army service. Includes studio photographs of Apache Indians, military personnel and living quarters at Fort Leavenworth, Kansas; Fort Grant, Arizona; and Fort Apache, Arizona.

scopecontent.p: Nine photographs, chiefly officers at Fort Leavenworth, Fort Grant, San Carlos, and other places. Several photos with photographer's stamp.
Five photographs of interiors of homes; one photograph of exterior of home, Finley and others on porch; one photograph of officers and families on horseback; one group portrait 10th Cavalry Troop A.

One photograph of officers and family on steps; one photograph of interior of Finley quarters; one photograph of exterior officer's quarters with families in yard; one photograph of exterior parade grounds, troops, tennis courts, officer's quarters, and lake. Two photographs include Bakers and Johnston stamp.
Seven photographs, include D.A. Markey stamp.
Five drawings. One postcard depicting scenes of Chiricahua prisoners en route from Arizona to Fort Augustine, Florida, 1886.
Two photographs. Carriage at base of cliff dwelling ruins, possibly in northern Arizona. Portrait of Cooley's three daughters by Native American mother, Arizona.
